messages: b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:19): there does seem to be a strong expert-bias in public-html
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:23): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: what do you mean by expert-bias?

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:25): the comment that brought it about was Philip Taylor's "allowing the craziness of a small number of individuals to outweigh the combined wisdom of all those who formulated the specification for HTML 4.01"
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:27): the idea being that an expert's opinion is worth far more than anyone else's, in short

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:27): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: curiously, those who formulated HTML 4.01 are automatically assumed to have had wisdom whereas those who formulate HTML 5 aren't
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:27): I guess that happens when a spec is old enough
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:27): interesting how people acquire mythical status over time. :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:28): yeah, despite the fact that we have a whole 10 years worth of real world evidence that the HTML4 WG didn't have
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:31): why don't we just continue using SGML? fuck the real world, it keeps us consistent with the wisdom of HTML 4.01
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:33): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, XML is the future, SGML failed
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:33): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: but that goes against the wisdom of the old HTML WG!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:34): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: and they must be right!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:34): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: and you can't say anything to change that!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:34): the old HTMLWG already began the migration to XML as soon as it became available
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:34): they ditched HTML4 after XHTML1
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:34): I imagine who you define as an expert is a function of how much your views and theirs match up. :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:35): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: were they still called the HTML WG?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:35): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f, I define you as an expert :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:35): defines self as idiot
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:35): Did they actually care about SGML when writing HTML4, or did they just keep using it because that's what the previous versions of HTML used?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: IIRC it's that they didn't want to reverse engineer everything
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:35): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, yes, the status of XHTML1 still talks about the "HTML Working Group"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: when did the name change?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:36): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: the rechartering this year?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:36): it changed from HTML WG to XHTML2 WG earlier this year
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:36): so yeah
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:37): I'm sure they just kept using it based on the wisdom of those who wrote HTML 3.2 using SGML
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:37): which was in turn based on the wisdom of those who wrote HTML2
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:37): which was actually not based on the wisdom of TBL who didn't originally use SGML when he first created it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:38): which was based on the criticism of the IIIR-HTML draft?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:38): So they were following the SGML cow path? :-)
